Keeping your family healthy and safe fro: Keeping your family healthy and safe from COVID-19 can feel even harder when you live in crowded conditions. There are things you can do to make it eacier for your family.
Limit those leaving and returning to you: Limit those leaving and returning to your immediate living space to as few and as infrequent as possible.
Know the COVID-19 rules about what you c: Know the COVID-19 rules about what you can and can't do in your area.
Help your children with physical distanc: Help your children with physical distancing
Explain to your children that they have: Explain to your children that they have an important job of keeping themselves and their community healthy by temporarily physically distancing from others.
Show them extra positive attention when: Show them extra positive attention when they make an effort to practice safe physical distancing from others.
It might be hard to find soap and water,: It might be hard to find soap and water, but practicing good hygiene is more important now than ever.
Try to wash all family members' hands as: Try to wash all family members' hands as often as possible with soap and water.
Help children teach each other how to wa: Help children teach each other how to wash their hands with soap and water.
Encourage children to avoid touching the: Encourage children to avoid touching their face.
Looking after children and other family: Looking after children and other family members is difficult in cramped space, but it's much easier when responsibilites are shared.
Try to share household chores, childcare: Try to share household chores, childcare, and other tasks equally amongst family members.
Create a schedule for time \"on\" and ti: Create a schedule for time "on" and time "off" with other adults in your household.
It is okay to ask for help when you are: It is okay to ask for help when you are feeling tired or stressed so that you can take a break.
Encourage children to think of activitie: Encourage children to think of activities they can do to excercise while avoiding contact with who do not already live in your immediate space.
Jumping activities, dancing or running i: Jumping activities, dancing or running in circles in circles can be fun!
You might not have space to yourself to: You might not have space to yourself to deal with all the stress and emotions you are feeling.
Notice when you are feeling stressed or: Notice when you are feeling stressed or upset and take a pause...even three deep breaths can make a difference!
Well done! Millions of families find tha: Well done! Millions of families find that this helps.
Keeping positive, having a routine and t: Keeping positive, having a routine and trying to get some one-on-one time with each child, when you can, will help you manage your children's behaviours and your feelings.
